properties.NAME: Teufelsberg Field Station
properties.DESCRIPTION: An abandoned former Cold War NSA field station in Grunewald, located on a rubble mountain.
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Teufelsberg (German for Devil's Mountain) is a man-made hill in Berlin, Germany, in the Grunewald locality of former West Berlin. It rises about 80 metres (260 ft) above the surrounding Teltow plateau and 120.1 metres (394 ft) above the sea level, in the north of Berlin's Grunewald Forest. It was named after the Teufelssee (i.e. Devil's lake) in its southerly vicinity. The hill is made of rubble, and covers an under-construction Nazi military-technical college. During the Cold War, there was a U.S. NSA listening station on the hill. The site of the former Field Station is now fenced off and is currently being managed by an organisation which charges 5 to 10 Euros for public access.

properties.NAME: Tempelhof Airport
properties.DESCRIPTION: Closed Former Airport which has subsequently been used as a recreational space known as Tempelhofer Feld.
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Berlin Tempelhof Airport (German: Flughafen Berlin-Tempelhof) was one of the first airports in Berlin, Germany. Situated in the south-central Berlin borough of Tempelhof-Schöneberg, the airport ceased operating in 2008 amid controversy, leaving Tegel and Schönefeld as the two main airports serving the city, with the new Berlin Brandenburg Airport still under construction as of 2019. The former airfield has subsequently been used as a recreational space known as Tempelhofer Feld.

properties.NAME: Spreepark Amusement Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: An abandoned amusement park in the north of the Plänterwald in the Berlin district Treptow-Köpenick.
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: The entertainment park was opened in 1969 as Kulturpark Plänterwald, covering an area of 29.5 hectares. The area is situated in the north of the Plänterwald, next to the river Spree. It was the only constant entertainment park in the GDR, and the only such park in either East or West Berlin. In August 2002 the park was declared completely insolvent and since 2002 the park has not opened for visitors. The Ferris wheel still stands, but has not operated since the park's closure, likewise, the remains of other attractions can still be found on-site.

properties.NAME: Blub Water Park
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Blub is short for 'Berliner Luft- und Badeparadies' or Berlin Air and Bathing Paradise in English. It first opened in Neukölln back in February 1985. Everything came to an end on February 2005 when the water park was shut down.

properties.NAME: Johannisthal Airfield
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located southeast of central Berlin, Johannisthal was Germany's first commercial airfield.
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Located southeast of central Berlin, Johannisthal was Germany's first commercial airfield. It opened on 26 September 1909, a few weeks after the world's first airfield at Rheims, France. Known as the birthplace of heavier-than-air flight in Germany, Johannistal was Berlin's primary airport until the Tempelhofer Field was developed in the 1920's. Later, the area became known as Adlershof, and before the collapse of the Berlin Wall, it was closed to the public.

properties.NAME: Bärenquell Brewery
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Bärenquell closed its doors for the last time on April Fools' Day, 1994, ending its time as a brewery after 112 years. It had opened as the Borussia Brauerei in 1882, later bought by Schultheiss AG and expanded in 1898. Called VEB Bärenquell in GDR times, it produced one of Berlin's most popular beers, renowned for its good taste. By the time of its closure it was one of the 'big four' breweries along with Kindl, Berliner Pilsener and Schultheiss.

properties.NAME: Dynamo Sporthotel Hohenschönhausen
properties.DESCRIPTION: Former GDR sport hotel and congress center.
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: The Dynamo sporthotel Hohenschönhausen or 'Sporthotel und Kongresszentrum des Sportforums' as it was called in GDR times was constructed from 1954 on and  is around 45 hectares big. Comprising a football stadium, gymnastics halls, ice-skating halls, indoor and outdoor facilities. It was abandoned around 2007.

properties.NAME: Pankow Freight Yard
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Built in 1893 the freight yard (German: Rundlokschuppen) in Pankow was finally abandoned in 1997. The former railroad yard or freight station with two train turntables, one inside, one outside, used to handle up to 1,800 freight cars a day.

properties.NAME: Pankow Summer Baths
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Pankow Summer Baths (German: Pankow Schwimmhalle), an indoor swimming pool complex with one big pool, one little pool, a sauna and all the changing rooms, showers and swim-related accessories you’d expect.

properties.NAME: Abandoned GDR Iraqi Embassy
properties.DESCRIPTION: The former Iraqi Embassy of East Berlin.
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: The Iraqi embassy was built in 1974. The non-descript pre-fabricated concrete building (the Plattenbau style so common in Soviet-era East Germany) sits in a quiet cul-de-sac in the former diplomatic quarter of the GDR in Pankow. Iraq was the first non-Socialist country to recognise the GDR as a state in 1969 and a special friendship developed between the two countries. It is widely believed that the GDR was offering scientific help to Iraq, particularly with their development of nuclear and chemical weapons. By 1991, the Iraqi embassy was abandoned.

properties.NAME: Die Wiesenburg - Homeless Shelter
properties.DESCRIPTION: Former homeless shelter, now partially used as artists space.
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: Die Wiesenburg was opened in 1896 as a new and modern homeless shelter by the Berliner Obdachlos Asyl Verein to accommodate the growing numbers of homeless people in Berlin. It was a partly self-sufficient facility with its own electricity supply and a 112 m deep well. Quickly called ‘Die Wiesenburg’ amongst the homeless, it provided up to 21,000 short-term shelter places per month. Abandoned in the 80ies there it's now run by an artist's association.

properties.NAME: Siemensbahn S-Bahn Route
properties.DESCRIPTION: Abandoned railway line through Siemensstadt, formerly the epicenter for Siemens.’ industrial activity
properties.FULL_DESCRIPTION: The Siemensbahn is an S-Bahn line in Berlin. It is named after the company Siemens & Halske, who built the line on their own between 1927 and 1929. It is almost four and a half kilometers long and has been out of service since the Reichsbahn strike in September 1980. There are plans to reactivate the line by 2025.
